links.title: The activeTab permission - Google Chrome
links.description:
The activeTab permission gives an extension temporary access to the
currently active tab when the user invokes the extension - for example
by clicking its browser action. Access to the tab
lasts while the user is on that page, and is revoked when the user navigates
away or closes the tab.

address, the attacker takes control.  Much of the hardening work over the
years has focused on making it harder to overwrite addresses in this way.

links.title: Stratospheric aerosol injection - Wikipedia
links.description: The ability of stratospheric sulfate aerosols to create a global dimming effect has made them a possible candidate for use in solar radiation management climate engineering projects[1] to limit the effect and impact of climate change due to rising levels of greenhouse gases.[2] Delivery of precursor sulfide gases such as sulfuric acid,[3] hydrogen sulfide (H2S) or sulfur dioxide (SO2) by artillery, aircraft[4] and balloons has been proposed.[5]

links.title: Marine cloud brightening - Wikipedia
links.description: Marine cloud brightening is a proposed solar radiation management climate engineering technique that would make clouds brighter, reflecting a small fraction of incoming sunlight back into space in order to offset anthropogenic global warming.
